intro: Trichera pancicii, commonly known as the Pancici's trichera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
